Margin and Padding Horizhontally.

Notes on Padding and Margin in Tailwind CSS:

  • Margin: Controls the space outside an element. Classes like m-4 (all sides), mt-4 (top), mr-4 (right), mb-4 (bottom), ml-4 (left).
  • Padding: Controls the space inside an element. Classes like p-4 (all sides), pt-4 (top), pr-4 (right), pb-4 (bottom), pl-4 (left).
  • Directional: Use mx-4 for horizontal margins, my-4 for vertical margins. Same for px and py.
  • Values: Sizes range from 0 to 96, with rem units (e.g., m-4 = 1rem).
  • Negative margins: Use -m-4 for negative margins.
  • Auto margins: mx-auto centers elements horizontally.
